Subsubsection Text: 33% 26% 27% 30% 43% 36% 33% 24% 14% 25% 19 16 **25 21** 19 14 **23 7** **8 24** 16 **31** 23 **26 30 28** 17 18 8 8 7 7 13 10 7 6 6 6 1 2 2012 2013 2014 2015 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 Filmed at Pinewood facilities Other blockbusters Proportion filmed at Pinewood Source: Industry sources. (1) Includes blockbuster films that were filmed at Pinewood Atlanta Studios, a studio we divested our equity interest in on August 5, 2019. Our relationships with all major film production companies span decades, including more than 50 years for NBCUniversal, Eon Productions, Disney and 20th Century Fox. Historically, major film production companies have been attracted to our facilities that are suitable to host blockbuster films, and over time this demand has driven our focus on blockbuster films. Our relationship with Netflix represents incremental demand beyond our historical customer base, having commenced in 2016.

Management estimates that in recent years our facilities have hosted a larger share of blockbuster films than any other operator globally, both among independent and major film production company-owned facilities. Between 2010 and 2021, 83 out of 274 blockbuster films were filmed at Pinewood-branded studios, representing 30% of all blockbuster films for that period. Among these 83 productions, 71 were filmed in the United Kingdom at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios and the remaining 12 were filmed at Pinewood Atlanta Studios and Pinewood Toronto Studios.

Subsection Title: The United Kingdom as a Global Production Hub
Subsubsection Title: Location of London Film Production Facilities[(1)]
Subsubsection Text: Source: British Film Commission, Facilities’ website. (1) As of the date of this Offering Memorandum. -----

Subsection Title: The United Kingdom as a Global Production Hub
Subsubsection Text: The United Kingdom’s success in the creative industries is driven by a wide range of specialist subsectors, creating a rich, cross-disciplinary environment for collaboration and innovation. The creative industries are defined by DCMS to include film and television production, software services, music, the performing arts, advertising and marketing, publishing and design. Employment in the creative industries grew at a CAGR of 4% between 2011 and 2021. In 2021, the creative industries employed over two million people, or about 7% of the United Kingdom’s work force. Within the United Kingdom, creative industries, film, and video production constitutes an important driver of employment, economic output and exports. In recent years, the United Kingdom has benefited from increase in production spend. According to BFI, production spend on UK feature films and High-end TV increased ----- at a CAGR of 15% between 2017 and 2021. Inward investments continue to drive the overall spending with bigger budget films taking space in the United Kingdom. The below table illustrates the total production spend in the UK on UK feature films and High-end TV over the last five years. According to the Office for National Statistics, as of 2020 there were approximately 65,967 film and video production workers in the United Kingdom, with an estimated 66% based in London and South East England, which is a draw for major film production companies seeking a location to produce blockbuster films or High-end TV. The production sector workforce has increased by approximately 78% since 2010, at a CAGR of approximately 6%. The production sector workforce has increased by 3% since 2017, at a CAGR of approximately 1%. The production sector workforce has increased by 57% since 2011, at a CAGR of approximately 6%. Blockbuster films and High-end TV require a wide range of highly specialised skills, such as camera operation, lighting and make up, and the United Kingdom has developed such a specialised workforce over the past decades to cater to such needs. The United Kingdom is among few global locations in which a production crew can be recruited entirely locally, without the need to fly in crew from other film centres. This reduces operational risk and complexity for producers, and enhances the United Kingdom’s attractiveness for blockbuster films and Highend TV. Another key attraction for major film production companies is the United Kingdom’s stable legal and regulatory framework. In particular, the United Kingdom has a long history of fostering the development of the film sector through tax incentives. Certain tax credits were introduced in 1992, and subsequently updated and extended by a series of governments in 1997, 2007 and 2015. Under current rules, film producers receive a cash rebate of 25% on the lower of (i) 80% of total core production expenditure, or (ii) 100% of total UK expenditure. Tax incentives for the film sector enjoy broad cross-party support, with politicians from all three major parties regularly citing film as a valuable contributor to the UK economy. UK tax incentives provide a tested and reliable framework for film producers allocating their production spend. It is important to note, however, that tax incentives for the film sector exist across many jurisdictions, including the US states (such as California, New York, Georgia and Louisiana), Canadian provinces (such as British Columbia, Ontario and Quebec), other European countries (including France, Germany and the Netherlands) as well as Australia and New Zealand. A more recent factor contributing to the United Kingdom’s attractiveness to major film production companies is the impact of the pound sterling’s devaluation following the vote for the United Kingdom to leave the European Union in June 2016, which reduced the relative cost of United Kingdom workers and facilities to global film production companies, whose budgets are usually set in US dollar. Within the United Kingdom, the area in close proximity to London accounts for the vast majority of film and television production. In 2020, London and the South East accounted for 71% of enterprises in the United Kingdom active in film and television production and post production activities. Despite London’s importance to the film sector, the ability to build new film production facilities is constrained by the scarcity of available land, the difficulty of obtaining planning permission and multiple high value alternative uses. As a consequence of London’s population growth and economic success, the competition for land for a variety of residential, commercial, social and community uses has intensified. Tracts of land ----- sufficiently large enough to build a large scale film production facility are rarely available near London. New film production facilities in the London area are often planned on smaller tracts of land, with less room for expansion.

Our operations comprise the following six business lines, each of which falls within three broader categories, and as such, we present them throughout this Offering Memorandum in this manner: - rental activities at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, comprising Stage and Other Production Accommodation, Media Hub and Television Studios; - ancillary activities at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, comprising Post Production and Ancillary Studio Services; and - other activities, primarily consisting of International Sales and Marketing. Rental activities are by far the largest contributor to our business, accounting for 92.6% of Contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021. Rental activities typically include income generated by the use of stages, workshops, offices, and TV studios. ----- Demand for our ancillary activities, accounting for 6.0% of Contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021, is driven in part by demand for our rental activities. These activities typically include post production services, recharging of utilities, and revenue/profit sharing arrangements with third-party providers. The chart below displays the percentage of our Contribution by business line for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021. A brief description of each of our business lines is set forth below. _Rental: Stage and Other Production Accommodation_ Our Stage and Other Production Accommodation business line relates to Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios. As our core business line, Stage and Other Production Accommodation drives the largest proportion of Contribution. Stage rental relates to the rental of stage space and infrastructure required to produce screen content. The stages are used to house the physical set on which action and sounds are recorded. Our stages come in a variety of sizes and types and are generally soundproofed and heated. Pursuant to the Long-term Contracts, 100% of our existing stage space at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios has been contracted by Disney and Netflix, respectively. Other Production Accommodation rental primarily relates to the renting of office space and workshop space where sets are created or stored. Demand for Other Production Accommodation is typically driven by demand for our stages. Pursuant to the terms of the Long-term Contracts, 100% of our existing Other Production Accommodation space at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios has been contracted by Disney and Netflix, respectively. See “—Material Contracts—Disney Long-term Contract” and “—Material Contracts—Netflix Long_term Contract.” Stage and Other Production Accommodation as a percentage of Contribution has continued to increase with the completion of approximately 205,000 square feet of lettable space at Pinewood East Phase 2, which was completed in autumn 2019 (with one of the workshop blocks, totalling approximately 39,000 square feet, completed in summer 2020), and will increase further by approximately 1.1 million square feet in aggregate upon completion of the five new stages at Pinewood West, Shepperton North West and Shepperton South development projects. Disney has pre-let the five new stages at Pinewood West as part of the Disney Long-term Contract and Netflix has pre-let approximately 60% of the space being developed at the Shepperton South studio. For more information on our Stage and Other Production Accommodation business line, see “—Our Business Lines— _Rental—Stage and Other Production Accommodation.” Rental: Media Hub_ We lease space on-site to independent companies that support film and television production. Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios offer approximately 228,000 square feet of space, to approximately 178 independent businesses as of September 30, 2021. The tenants pay rent directly to us and supply their services to ----- the production companies filming at the studios, as well as to external “off-the-lot” customers. Tenants in our Media Hub benefit from association with our strong brand and proximity to their customer base. Historically, the Media Hub has been a secure source of Contribution. There is significant demand for on-site space, with occupancy rates averaging 95% over the past ten fiscal years to the fiscal year ended March 31, 2021. For more information, see “Summary—Our Key Strengths—Resilient and Cash Generative Business Model Now _Underpinned by Long-term Contracts.” All turnover generated under the Long-term Contracts is reported under_ Stage and Other Production Accommodation. Accordingly, at the commencement of the Long-term Contracts, certain turnover previously reported under the Media Hub business line moved to Other Production Accommodation with any reallocation of the demises in connection with the Long-term Contracts. For more information on our Media Hub business line, see “—Our Business Lines— Rental—Media Hub.” _Rental: Television Studios_ We have three dedicated Television Studios available to hire at Pinewood Studios, one of which is contracted to the National Lottery (Camelot). We have relationships with customers such as the BBC, Endemol Shine UK, Fremantle and Avalon, which contribute to the success of this business line. In addition to earning turnover from Television Studio space, we generate turnover from supplying freelance crew as well as owned and hired television equipment. The Television Studios at Pinewood Studios are excluded from the Disney Long-term Contract and we will continue to manage and hire the Television Studios on a case-by-case basis. For more information on our Television Studios business line, see “—Our Business Lines—Rental—Television Studios.” _Ancillary: Ancillary Studio Services_ Ancillary Studio Services comprise additional services utilised by production companies hiring Stage and Other Production Accommodation. The key services we provide in this business line are utilities (for example, we offer electricity, water and gas, which are principally passed through at cost to our long-term contract customers) and other services through revenue or profit-sharing agreements with preferred third-party service providers. For more information on our Ancillary Studio Services business line, see “—Our Business Lines— _Ancillary—Ancillary Studio Services.” Ancillary: Post Production_ Post Production provides support to content creators. This business line includes localisation services which offer audio mixing in multiple languages for our customers requiring international re-versioning services. In addition, through this business line we offer our customers mixing theatres, cutting rooms, and production offices available for dry hire at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, all of which are excluded from the Long-term Contracts. For more information, see “—Our Business Lines—Ancillary—Post Production.” _Other Activities_ We also generate turnover by providing sales, marketing and brand licensing services and consultancy services relating to studio space to other studios around the world. Historically, we provided these services to studios in Atlanta, Canada, China, the Dominican Republic, Malaysia, and Wales. On August 5, 2019, we divested our equity interest in Pinewood Atlanta Studios, although we continued to provide sales and marketing services until October 14, 2020, and it ceased to be a Pinewood branded studio on December 14, 2020. We separately ceased providing services to studios in Malaysia in July 2019 and in Wales on March 31, 2020.

We are one of the leading independent providers of the infrastructure that is required to produce film and television content. Founded in 1936 and headquartered in the United Kingdom, we own premium, large-scale facilities, also known as studios, for hosting film, television and other media productions. Our two freehold studios, Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, are set over 502 acres with approximately 2.0 million square feet of space in close proximity to central London, which makes us a preferred choice for major film production companies. Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios are valued at a Market Value of £2,158 million pursuant to the Valuation Report. Pinewood-branded studios have hosted over 2,000 films, which have received among them 170 Oscar awards and 230 BAFTA awards and include numerous blockbuster film productions such as 23 out of the 25 James Bond films, 16 out of the 27 Marvel super hero films and 8 out of the 12 Star Wars films. We signed long-term index-linked contracts for 100% of our Stage and Other Production Accommodation at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios with Disney and Netflix, respectively in 2019. Collectively, these Long-term Contracts cover a total of approximately 1.6 million square feet. These contracts are each for an initial term of at least ten years and provide for annual rent increases, subject to floors. Disney utilises Pinewood Studios for its own productions as well as for its affiliated production companies, including Lucasfilm and Marvel. Netflix utilises Shepperton Studios as a production hub to produce original content. The Long-term Contracts simplify our business model, improve the resilience and visibility of our turnover from investment-grade rated tenants, and demonstrate the continued demand for our facilities at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios. See “—Material Contracts—Disney Long-term Contract” and “—Material Contracts— _Netflix Long-term Contract.”_ Demand for purpose-built studio space remains extremely strong. Over the last few years, we have been progressing our expansion plans at our UK studios, Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios. Construction is currently underway for five new stages at Pinewood Studios that will provide approximately 100,000 square feet of additional stage space at Pinewood West, which we anticipate opening in 2022. Disney has pre-let these stages pursuant to the Disney Long-term Contract. At Shepperton Studios, we have detailed planning consent to develop an additional approximately 1.0 million square feet of lettable area, adjacent to the existing studio. We intend to develop this expansion in two phases, which we refer to as Shepperton North West and Shepperton South. Construction of both phases is underway and we have entered into fixed price contracts for the works, thereby significantly derisking the execution of these projects. Additionally, we entered into a long-term contract with Netflix to pre-let approximately 0.5 million square feet of space, equivalent to 60% of the space being developed, at our Shepperton South studio. The lease will commence on completion of the development, expected towards the end of 2023, and is on terms similar to the Netflix Long-term Contract. There is strong interest from several customers for the remaining approximately 0.5 million square feet being developed at Shepperton. In the twelve months ended September 30, 2021, Contribution from Stage and Other Production Accommodation, together with the specialty stages, accounted for 83.8% of total Contribution. We earned 98.6% of our total Contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021 in the United Kingdom, with 92.6% representing rental income at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, our two freehold studios.

Subsubsection Title: Resilient and Cash Generative Business Model Underpinned by Long-term Contracts
Subsubsection Text: As a result of the Long-term Contracts, 100% of the Group’s existing Stage and Other Production Accommodation is under contract for an initial term of at least ten years, providing long-term visibility on future turnover. In the twelve months ended September 30, 2021, Contribution from Stage and Other Production Accommodation, together with the specialty stages, accounted for 83.8% of total Contribution. Rent under the Long-term Contracts is linked to UK RPI, with annual rental rate increases. See “—Material Contracts.” Our Long-term Contracts have not been impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. Prior to entering into the Long-term Contracts, our studios had a long history of consistently operating at what we believe to be our structural maximum occupancy levels under a model of short-term hire agreements. In addition, our Media Hub business line has also demonstrated consistently high occupancy rates historically. ----- For the past ten fiscal years, our Media Hub business line occupancy rates averaged 95%. For more information, see “—Our Business Lines—Rental—Media Hub.” We have a proven track record of stable or growing Adjusted EBITDA generation, including during both the global financial crisis and the COVID-19 pandemic. We also benefit from high Adjusted EBITDA margins. For example, we had an Adjusted EBITDA margin of 64% for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021 and 65% for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2021. The high Adjusted EBITDA margins are attributable to our business model focused on providing infrastructure related offerings. Our Adjusted EBITDA margin tends to increase as we expand the space at our existing studios while leveraging on our existing central and operative functions. In addition, our results benefit from having ceased a number of low margin or loss-making activities. See “Summary—Summary Historical Financial Information and Other Data—Statistical, As Adjusted and Other _Financial Data.”_ (1) Joint ventures were proportionally consolidated in accordance with UK GAAP until the fiscal year ended March 31, 2013; from the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014, joint ventures were accounted for under the equity method in accordance with IFRS. Our year-end was December 31 until 2010. Adjusted EBITDA for the year ended December 31, 2011 was based on interim results for twelve-month period ended Dec 31, 2011. The fiscal year ended March 31, 2013 reflects a twelve-month fiscal year ending on March 31, 2013. In 2021 we entered into an agreement for lease with Netflix in respect of stages, workshops and offices at Shepperton Studios in relation to the Shepperton Expansion Project. See “—Material Contracts—Netflix _Shepperton South Long-term Contract.” For the twelve months ended September 30, 2021, our_ _Pro Forma_ Adjusted EBITDA would have been £94.3 million, giving pro forma effect to the anticipated EBITDA effects of certain pre-leased space currently being constructed as part of the expansion projects to be funded in connection with the Offering and adding back the effect of certain costs related to the UK Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme, as illustrated in the table below. For a reconciliation of Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA, see “Summary—Summary _Historical Financial Information and Other Data—Statistical, As Adjusted and Other Financial Data.”_ ----- We have averaged over 93% cash conversion over the past three fiscal years ended March 31, 2021, calculated as Adjusted EBITDA less maintenance capital expenditure as a percentage of Adjusted EBITDA. Maintenance capital expenditure has averaged approximately £3.4 million per annum for the three fiscal years ended March 31, 2021. In addition to this maintenance capital expenditure, we recognised an average of approximately £4.3 million of maintenance spend per annum as an expense within indirect costs for the three fiscal years ended March 31, 2021. See “Summary—Summary Historical and Financial Information and Other _Data—Statistical, As Adjusted and Other Financial Data.”_

Subsubsection Title: World Class Facilities with Significant Freehold Backing
Subsubsection Text: We own the freehold interest of both Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, which are valued at a Market Value of £2,158 million pursuant to the Valuation Report. Pro forma for the remaining capex expected to be incurred for the Shepperton Expansion Project and new stage construction at Pinewood West, the adjusted valuation would be £2,672 million. This valuation is supported by the Disney Long-term Contract and the Netflix Long-term Contract which ensure 100% occupancy of our current Stage and Other Production Accommodation for the duration of the contracts, each of which has an initial term of at least ten years as well as the Netflix Shepperton South Long-term Contract. Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios are the two largest independent studios in the United Kingdom with a combined approximate 2.0 million square feet of space set over 502 acres and 25 and 14 stages, respectively, close to central London and Heathrow airport. Pinewood Studios is one of the largest independently operated studios in the world in terms of stage space, with approximately 1.4 million square feet of total space on an approximately 379-acre site. It currently has two facilities, Pinewood West and Pinewood East. Shepperton Studios has approximately 600,000 square feet of total space situated on an approximately 123-acre site. It currently has one facility, Shepperton North, and two additional facilities under development, Shepperton North West and Shepperton South. Our studios are capable of hosting productions of various budgets simultaneously. We believe, however, that production companies view our studios as a premium offering well suited for large budget productions, for release either in theatres or on streaming platforms, given the extent and quality of the infrastructure available. Our studios feature a wide range of different size purpose-built stages, workshops, and offices as well as specialised facilities such as exterior and interior water tanks, backlots, television stages, and post production facilities. We further believe that our operational capabilities, resulting from decades of experience running a secured environment, providing 24/7 access where the most demanding production companies can operate, also differentiates us from most of our competitors. -----

Subsubsection Title: Market Leading Position and Iconic Brand
Subsubsection Text: The Pinewood brand is globally recognised with over 80 years’ experience, over which Pinewoodbranded studios have hosted iconic film moments. A selection of the films and High-end TV we have hosted includes: 1960s: Six _James Bond_ films including _Dr. No_ (the first _James Bond_ film), _Lawrence of Arabia, Dr. _Strangelove, 2001: A Space Odyssey, To Sir, with Love, and Chitty Chitty Bang Bang_ 1970s: _Superman, Fiddler on the Roof, The Great Gatsby, The Thirty Nine Steps, The Omen and Alien 1980s: _Batman, Superman II, Gandhi, Full Metal Jacket, Out of Africa, Blade Runner, The Princess Bride and Aliens 1990s: _Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves, Interview with the Vampire, Patriot Games, The Fifth Element, _Mission Impossible and The Mummy_ 2000s: _Gladiator, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, Love Actually, Casino Royale, The Da Vinci Code, _The Bourne Ultimatum and Mamma Mia!_ 2010: _Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part I, Clash of the Titans and Robin Hood 2011: _Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows, X-Men: First Class and_ _Pirates of the Caribbean: On _Stranger Tides_ 2012: _Snow White and the Huntsman, The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey and Skyfall 2013: _Thor: The Dark World, Fast and Furious 6 and Gravity 2014: _Exodus: Gods and Kings, Maleficent and Guardians of the Galaxy 2015: _Spectre, The Avengers: Age of Ultron and Star Wars: The Force Awakens (Episode VII) 2016: _The Huntsman: Winter’s War, Assassin’s Creed and Rogue One: A Star Wars Story 2017: _Star Wars: The Last Jedi (Episode VIII), The Mummy and Kingsman: The Golden Circle 2018: _Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom, Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again and Mary Poppins Returns 2019: _Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker (Episode IX), Rocketman,_ _Dumbo and The Innocents (Season 1) 2020: _1917, Criminal (Season 2), The Expanse (Season 5), The Old Guard and The Midnight Sky 2021: _No Time To Die, RuPaul’s Drag Race UK (Series 2), The Dig, Old, Cruella, Jupiter’s Legacy, _Cinderella, Eternals and Black Widow_ Between 2010 and 2021, 83 out of 274 blockbuster films were filmed at Pinewood-branded studios, representing 30% of all blockbuster films for that period. Among these 83 productions, 71 were filmed in the United Kingdom at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios and the remaining 12 were filmed at Pinewood Atlanta Studios and Pinewood Toronto Studios. -----

Subsubsection Title: Total Blockbuster Films and Proportion Filmed at Pinewood (2010-2021)[(1)]
Subsubsection Text: Source: Industry sources. (1) Includes blockbuster films that were filmed at Pinewood Atlanta Studios, a studio we divested our equity interest in on August 5, 2019 and which ceased to be a Pinewood branded studio on December 14, 2020. For more information, see “—Our Business Lines—Other Activities—International Sales and Marketing” and_ “Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations—Key Factors Affecting Comparability of Future _Results of Operations—Exit from Joint Ventures and Third-Party Studio Licenses—Pinewood Atlanta Studios Joint Venture and Management Services Agreement.”_

Our customers operate in a market with strong underlying demand, which is driven by consumption of content, principally blockbuster films and from online streaming platforms. In recent years, and particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic, demand for content from streaming platforms has accelerated. To match this demand, OTT operators have significantly increased their investments in content production. The number of streaming platforms has multiplied in recent years, and operators continue to invest considerably in streaming content, such as Disney, Apple, NBCUniversal and Warner Media. Disney has invested in Disney+, its own direct-to-consumer streaming platform, and expects their investment in original content for this streaming platform to exceed $8 billion by 2024, more than double the amount that was estimated in April 2019. When Disney launched Disney+ in November 2019, 10 million people subscribed on the first day. Disney+ had 87 million subscribers as of September 30, 2021 and is targeting between 230 and 260 million subscribers by 2024. In 2019, Apple increased its committed spending for original video content over the next several years from $1.0 billion to $6.0 billion. NBCUniversal, owned by Comcast, launched its own OTT platform, Peacock, in April 2020 and had 19 million subscribers as of September 2021. Warner Media also launched its own OTT platform, HBO Max, in May 2020 and had 58 million subscribers as of June 2021. In 2021, Warner Media announced that it would premiere 17 movies simultaneously in theatres and on HBO Max in the United States. Collectively Disney, Apple, NBCUniversal, Comcast and Warner Media have over 100 million subscribers to their OTT platforms. We believe long-term planning associated with spending on original content by OTT operators and on franchise films (such as the Marvel super hero franchise, _Star Wars or James Bond), has resulted in larger and more predictable annual slates for a number of production companies. Consequently, such production companies are often committing to take production space further in advance of filming (traditionally three months in advance and now up to twelve months in advance). On the back of this demand, in 2019 we entered into the Long-term Contracts with Disney and Netflix who occupy space at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios. As we continue to see favorable demand-supply fundamentals for purpose-built studio infrastructure, in 2021 we entered into a new long-term contract with Netflix to pre-let approximately 0.5 million square feet of space, equivalent to 60% of the space being developed, at our Shepperton South studio. -----

The ability to attract large budget productions requires a complex ecosystem, including comprehensive infrastructure with excellent operations, a highly skilled English-speaking workforce (ideally based in close proximity to the studio), good transport links (particularly by air), and a location close to an international city where talent is willing to reside. We benefit from infrastructure developed over decades of hosting films, with a multitude of stage options, as well as a specialist underwater facility, a paddock tank and backlot sites for outdoor filming, ample workshop and office space, businesses on-site providing services to production companies, theatres on-site for post-production editing and convenient transport links. We also benefit from a convenient location, with both Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios approximately one hour from central London and approximately 30 minutes from Heathrow airport. Aside from convenience for our customers, being located close to central London offers certain other strategic advantages. According to the Office for National Statistics, as of 2020 there were approximately 65,967 film and video production workers in the United Kingdom, with an estimated 66% based in London and South East England, which is a draw for major film production companies seeking a location to produce blockbuster films or Highend TV. The production sector workforce has increased by approximately 78% since 2010, at a CAGR of approximately 6%. The production sector workforce has increased by 3% since 2017, at a CAGR of approximately 1%. Whereas studios in many other jurisdictions may require the transport and accommodation of film crews at significant cost, filming at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios provides proximate access to producers, directors, actors, cinematographers and a large skilled worker base including, among others, technicians, engineers, carpenters, make-up artists and wardrobe specialists. Top talent, including producers, directors and cast, are also attracted to London as a filming destination and temporary residence while filming. While there are a number of proposed new studios at various stages of development in the United Kingdom, we believe that any potential competitor would still experience difficulties in locating and developing similarly-sized, well-located sites near central London due to scarcity of land, planning restrictions, high alternative land use values and high build costs. Even if such a site were available, the considerable time and expense required to build similar infrastructure to that of Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, is likely to deter most new market entrants. Additionally, we benefit from relationships with multiple major film production companies spanning decades and such relationships cannot be easily or quickly replicated by new market entrants. See “Risk Factors—Risks Relating to Our Business.”

Subsubsection Title: Importance of Creative Industries to the UK Economy
Subsubsection Text: The United Kingdom’s success in the creative industries is driven by a wide range of specialist subsectors, creating a rich, cross-disciplinary environment for collaboration and innovation. The creative industries are defined by DCMS to include film and television production, software services, music, the performing arts, advertising and marketing, publishing, and design. Employment in the creative industries grew at a CAGR of 4% between 2011 and 2021. In 2021, the creative industries employed over two million people, or about 7% of the United Kingdom’s work force. Within the United Kingdom creative industries, film and video production constitutes an important driver of employment, economic output and exports. In recent years, the United Kingdom has benefited from increase in production spend. According to BFI, production spend on UK feature films and High-end TV increased at a CAGR of 15% between 2017 and 2021. Inward investments continue to drive the overall spending with bigger budget films taking space in the United Kingdom.

Subsubsection Title: Solid Growth Potential with Demonstrated Track Record of Development
Subsubsection Text: We have achieved consistent growth over the past several years, with Adjusted EBITDA increasing from £44.7 million in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2019 to £64.0 million in the twelve month period ended September 30, 2021. This growth has principally been driven by our core rental business with steady demand-led increases in our rental rates, increased occupancy and investment in the business. A significant driver in our ability to generate cash has been our track record of pre-letting and completing development projects on time and within budget. For example, (i) in 2016, we developed approximately 300,000 square feet in connection with Pinewood East Phase 1, and (ii) in 2019, we developed approximately 205,000 square feet in connection with Pinewood East Phase 2 (with one of the workshop blocks, totalling approximately ----- 39,000 square feet, completed in summer 2020). Pinewood East Phase 1 and Pinewood East Phase 2 were leased prior to or immediately after completion, demonstrating our track record of accurately assessing demand and judicious approach to development. In recent years, we have experienced, and continue to experience, excess demand which we believe we will be able to accommodate through further expansion of our existing studios. At Pinewood Studios, we have planned for future revenue growth through pre-letting five sound stages, currently under construction, to Disney and through obtaining planning consent for the future development of Pinewood East Phase 3. Additionally, we own two undeveloped land sites adjacent to the existing facilities totalling approximately 165 acres, which we may use for development in the future. At Shepperton Studios, we are pursuing an expansion on the undeveloped land adjacent to the existing facilities totalling approximately 97 acres, which would add a further approximately 1.0 million square feet of space. The expansion has been substantially de-risked with the long-term contract with Netflix and the signing of a fixed price contract for the construction. Collectively, these projects will allow us to nearly double our stage space in the United Kingdom, allowing us to maintain our market leading position.

Subsubsection Title: Focus on Our Core Business Lines: Offering the Infrastructure Required for the Production of Film and Television Content
Subsubsection Text: In the last four years, we: (i) eliminated several non-core activities, including Media Investment, (ii) rationalised our international presence by exiting our 40% equity interest in Pinewood Atlanta Studios as well as terminated our agreements for studios in Wales and Malaysia, and (iii) entered into the Long-term Contracts, derisking our future Stage and Other Production Accommodation turnover. We intend to continue to remain focused on providing the infrastructure required to produce film and television content and providing exceptional customer service. To achieve this, we recognise that our people, processes, and systems are fundamental to our success, and we continue to invest in each of these aspects of our business.

Subsubsection Title: Continue to Expand Our Footprint at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios
Subsubsection Text: In autumn 2019, we completed the development of Pinewood East Phase 2, comprising approximately 205,000 square feet of stage, workshop and office space (with one of the workshop blocks, totalling approximately 39,000 square feet, completed in summer 2020). The entire development is included in the demise of the Disney Long-term Contract. Looking ahead, we are actively pursuing various expansion projects at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios that will allow us to meet the stable, excess demand for our facilities. The United Kingdom, with its established ecosystem and stable tax incentives, remains one of the most attractive markets for major film production companies and streaming platforms to produce content. We believe that our established locations, combined with the existing infrastructure at our UK studios, afford us a competitive advantage. At Pinewood Studios, and as part of the Disney Long-term Contract, Disney pre-let five new stages at Pinewood West, for which construction is underway and is expected to complete in 2022, adding approximately 100,000 square feet of lettable area and contributing to the future growth of the business. Additionally, the Group also has outline planning consent to develop a further approximately 120,000 square feet in relation to Pinewood East Phase 3. In addition, in September 2020, we submitted an outline planning consent application for the 77 ----- acre site adjacent to Pinewood Studios which we acquired in August 2020 and we refer to as Pinewood South. We expect to receive a decision from the local planning authority before January 2022, and if successful, the planning application would give us the ability to build a global screen industries growth hub comprising (i) additional production accommodation space, (ii) a visitor experience, (iii) an education hub, and (iv) a business growth hub totaling approximately 750,000 square feet. See “—Studios and Facilities—Pinewood Studios.” At Shepperton Studios, we are pursuing an expansion which will add a further 17 new sound stages and Other Production Accommodation space totalling approximately 1.0 million square feet of lettable area in aggregate across two phases. Shepperton North West, the first phase of this expansion, comprises three sound stages and Other Production Accommodation totalling approximately 165,000 square feet. Enabling and early works commenced in May 2021 and we contracted Sir Robert McAlpine to undertake the main works for the development in October 2021. The development is expected to complete in the first half of 2023. Shepperton South, the second larger phase of the expansion, comprises 14 sound stages and Other Production Accommodation totalling approximately 800,000 square feet. Enabling and early works commenced in August 2021 and we have signed a fixed-price main works contract with Laing O’Rourke in November 2021. The development is expected to complete towards the end of 2023. Additionally, we entered into a long-term contract with Netflix to pre-let approximately 0.5 million square feet of space, equivalent to 60% of the space being developed, at our Shepperton South studio. The lease will commence on completion of the development, expected towards the end of 2023, and is on terms similar to the Netflix Long-term Contract. There is strong interest from several customers for the remaining approximately 0.5 million square feet being developed at Shepperton. Our range of expansion plans that are underway and under consideration are projects, with both short and long-term timeframes, that will allow us to meet the demands of our customers. We continue to adopt a prudent approach to any expansion by conducting various detailed feasibility studies to assess viability and risks and also seek to de-risk the income by entering into long-term rental contracts in advance of the construction completion. In addition, if we undertake any future expansion opportunities for which work has not commenced, we will implement a prudent approach towards financing. We work with reputable construction companies with a track record of timely project completion and have contracts in place that incentivize timely and cost-efficient completions. Our business is highly cash generative and we expect to be able to fund a certain amount of expansionary investment through internal cash generation.

Subsubsection Title: Continue to Pursue Opportunities for International Expansion
Subsubsection Text: We believe there is an opportunity to expand our platform to key international markets. We believe the strength of our brand, industry relationships and operational expertise make us a partner and operator of choice for owners of international studios. Our international presence helps us strengthen our market leading position by providing global solutions to our clients. Expanding internationally allows us to capitalise on our existing brand and operational structure, resulting in synergies and an efficient use of resources. We have formulated our strategy for international expansion, focusing on key established markets within North America, Europe, Australia and emerging markets such as China and India, which could be attractive due to the rapidly growing box office sales and strong demand for locally produced content. Should we choose to enter or expand within these markets, we will likely do so by acquiring existing facilities, establishing partnerships with well capitalised, reputable, local owners or developers who recognise the value of partnering with us to brand and operate their studio, or selectively pursuing development opportunities ourselves.

Since the take private transaction in 2016, our strategy has been based on three pillars. This strategic focus, combined with strong underlying demand for our Stage and Other Production Accommodation and investment into the business has resulted in (i) the simplification of our business following the elimination of several non-core activities, (ii) growth in Adjusted EBITDA over the periods presented in this Offering Memorandum, and (iii) increased visibility of future turnover, pursuant to the Long-term Contracts. In the coming years we expect to continue to pursue these same strategies and progress our expansion plans.

Founded in 1936, we have an extensive track record spanning over 80 years during which we hosted some of the global screen-based industries’ most recognisable and commercially successful projects, which have received among them 170 Oscar awards and 230 BAFTA awards and include numerous blockbuster film productions such as 23 out of the 25 James Bond films, 16 out of the 27 Marvel super hero films, and 8 out of the 12 _Star Wars films. Since our founding, over 2,000 films have been filmed at studios operating under the Pinewood brand, including numerous well-known recordings, many of them blockbuster films. We have hosted numerous commercially successful and critically acclaimed films. In 1962, Dr. No, the first James Bond film, was produced at Pinewood Studios. From 1962 to 2019, 23 out of 25 total James Bond films were produced at our studios. In the 1980s, we hosted numerous blockbuster films such as _Batman_ and ----- _Aliens, marking the beginning of Pinewood Studios’ reputation as a home for blockbuster films. This reputation_ continues into the 1990s, 2000s and onwards with films such as Mission Impossible, Gladiator and Skyfall. In 2001, we reinforced our position as a key destination in the United Kingdom for major film and television productions with our acquisition of a 50% equity interest in Shepperton Studios, of which we acquired the remaining 50% equity interest in 2014. We further expanded our UK studios in 2016 with the opening of Pinewood East Phase 1. For further information on Pinewood East Phase 1, see “—Studios and Facilities.” In 2004, we completed our initial public offering and were subsequently listed on the Alternative Investment Market of the London Stock Exchange for over ten years. We were taken private in October 2016 in a transaction undertaken by a fund advised by Aermont, an independent asset management firm focused on real estate and real estate-related investment activities, which has served as investment advisor to four pan-European real estate investment funds with approximately €6.0 billion of total equity commitments, in aggregate. For more information, see “Our Shareholder.”

Rental activities are the largest contributor to our turnover and comprise stage rental and Other Production Accommodation rental under our Stage and Other Production Accommodation business line. The rental category contains three business lines (Stage and Other Production Accommodation, Media Hub and Television Studios) which in total accounted for 92.6% of our Contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021. _Stage and Other Production Accommodation_ Under our Stage and Other Production Accommodation business line, which, together with the specialty stages, accounted for 83.8% of our Contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021, we offer infrastructure required to produce screen content by third-parties through the rental of 38 stages, as well as other on-site filming facilities for film and television productions at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios. In addition, we have secured planning consents for 32 new stages. Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, our two freehold studios, are located in close proximity to central London and feature 24 stages and 14 stages, respectively. Stages range in size from approximately 3,000 square feet to over 59,000 square feet, including the “007” Stage at Pinewood Studios. Occupying 59,092 square feet, the “007” stage is the second largest stage in Europe and one of the largest Stages in the world. The “007” stage has hosted production activities for films such as Lara Croft: Tomb Raider, The Da Vinci Code, Charlie and _the Chocolate Factory, Mamma Mia!, Pirates of the Caribbean, as well as various James Bond films, including Spectre and No Time To Die. In total, Pinewood Studios has 11 large stages (in excess of 20,000 square feet), 12_ medium stages (from 5,000 square feet to 20,000 square feet) and one small stage (under 5,000 square feet) in addition to an underwater facility and an outdoor “paddock” water tank, while Shepperton Studios hosts one large stage, 11 medium stages and two small stages. At Pinewood Studios, and as part of the Disney Long-term Contract, we expect to deliver five new stages at Pinewood West, for which construction is underway and is expected to complete in 2022, adding approximately 100,000 square feet of additional stage space. We believe that because these stages are already pre-let by Disney pursuant to the Disney Long-term Contract, the risk associated with their development is limited. With respect to Shepperton Studios, we own a total of approximately 123-acres of land of which 97 acres has the potential for further development. The initial outline planning consent for the expansion and development of Shepperton Studios was obtained in July 2019. For more information on our expansion plans at Shepperton Studios please see, “Summary—Our Key Strengths—Solid Growth Potential with Demonstrated Track Record of _Development” and “Summary—Our Strategy—Continue to Expand Our Footprint at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios.”_ ----- Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios host a selection of backlots, gardens and woodlands available for outdoor shooting within a secure environment, including one of Europe’s largest exterior water “paddock” tanks, with capacity for 806,000 gallons of water, all of which are flexibly suitable for a variety of production types. The backlot areas, including the “paddock” tank are areas available to Disney for their use under the Disney Long-term Contract. The stages can also be used for pre-recorded television, music videos and commercials. For further information on Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, see “—Studios and Facilities.” _Stage interior at Pinewood Studios. © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited._ Historically, stage rental related to the rental of stage space for periods ranging from days to months, depending on the scale of the production. The stages are used to house the physical set on which action and sounds are recorded. These stages come in a variety of sizes and types, including an underwater facility, and are generally soundproofed and heated. Other Production Accommodation rental relates to the renting of office space and workshop space where sets are created. A large amount of office and workshop space is generally required for large scale productions, as producers prefer access to ancillary production elements on-site. We offer a total of approximately 1.6 million square feet of Stage and Other Production Accommodation across Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios. In 2019, we entered into the Disney Long-term Contract and Netflix Long-term Contract, which commenced on January 1, 2020 and October 31, 2019, respectively, for 100% of our Stage and Other Production Accommodation at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, respectively. Each Long-term Contract is for an initial term of at least ten years, materially changing the traditional, short-term hire business model and substantially improving our turnover visibility. ----- _Workshop space at Pinewood Studios. © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited. Office space at Pinewood Studios. © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited._ Our current stage occupancy is, and will be going forward, 100% under the Long-term Contracts. For the last ten years, we have maintained an average stage occupancy rate of approximately 95%, which is in part ----- due to our long-term relationships with the major global film production companies, including Disney, EON Productions, Lionsgate, MGM, Paramount Studios, Sony Pictures, NBCUniversal, Warner Bros. and Working Title. For further information on our Stage and Other Production Accommodation customers, see “—Our _Customers.” The demand for Other Production Accommodation spaces, such as offices and workshops that_ support production operations during on-site filming, has tended to be driven by the demand for stages. The commencement of the Long-term Contracts will reduce the risk and uncertainty on clients’ upcoming film slates and production needs as we will have greater certainty over rental payments. In 2021, we agreed to lease 50% of the space at Shepperton South on terms similar to the Long-term Contracts. There is strong interest from several customers for the remaining approximately 0.5 million square feet being developed at Shepperton. See “—Material Contracts.” Under standard terms for hires other than the Long-term Contracts, contracted bookings do not contain break clauses, and production companies are responsible for the full cost of their booking even in the case of cancellation. The position is replicated in the Long-term Contracts, where if either Disney or Netflix (as the case may be) do not require part or all of their contracted space, they can ask us to find a third-party production to hire the space. We will attempt (but are under no obligation) to secure a replacement booking but full rental fees remain payable by Disney and/or Netflix under the Long-term Contracts. Where entering into such resale bookings with third party clients, our experience and knowledge of the needs of productions is invaluable, managing the needs, type and size of stage, production offices or any other facilities that will be required. _Media Hub_ We lease space at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios to approximately 178 independent businesses that support film and television production, comprising approximately 228,000 square feet as of September 30, 2021. Tenants also benefit from a regular shuttle service to the nearest London Underground and mainline train stations, on-site parking, 24/7 access and on-site restaurants and coffee shops with outdoor areas. Our Media Hub is a significant contributor to the attractiveness of Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, as it offers a “one-stop-shop” model of space and service provision for all aspects of the film production process that cannot be easily replicated. Blockbuster films require a diverse and specialised workforce for filming and the Media Hub at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios helps to support such needs. The Media Hub accounted for 6.8% of our Contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021. For the past ten fiscal years, our Media Hub business line occupancy rates averaged 95%. Our Media Hub tenants are generally film, television or media-related business and are typically subject to lease terms ranging from twelve to 24 months. Tenants range from individual casting specialists, special effects technicians and a hair and makeup school to offices of large corporations such as Kodak Limited. Our Media Hub leases can be terminated upon (typically) three months’ notice or on expiry. The space is flexible and as evidenced by the Long-term Contracts, can be leased to production companies under our Stage and Other Production Accommodation business line. Space that was previously allocated to Media Hub has been transferred to Other Production Accommodation following the commencement of the Long-term Contracts. For more information on our Media Hub tenants, see “—Our Customers—Media Hub Tenants.” ----- _Special Underwater Facility_ We also have a specialist, permanently-filled indoor underwater facility at Pinewood Studios. This specialist underwater facility is not subject to the Disney Long-term Contract. _Underwater Stage at Pinewood Studios © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited Television Studios_ We offer three dedicated Television Studios which are located at Pinewood Studios and predominantly used for UK productions. The Television Studios business line accounted for 2.1% of our Contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021. These studios include two 8,960 square foot specialised Television Studios plus a third smaller studio, each fully equipped to film pre-recorded, live and live-audience television productions. The smaller studio, “TV3”, is currently leased to Camelot UK Lotteries Limited for the National Lottery under a multi-year contract. When not being used by Camelot, TV3 is available for hire by other television production companies. Recordings take place on fixed days of the week depending on whether live audiences are required. Film stages can also be temporarily converted to Television Studios when required (and Television Studios can be used for film production), providing additional flexibility. ----- _Television studio interior at Pinewood Studios. © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited._ Our digital Television Studios are generally rented for up to seven weeks (based on the number of television episodes to be filmed) and contract lengths vary widely. Our customers include the BBC, Endemol Shine UK, Fremantle and Camelot. Television production contracts have a broadly similar profile to our Stage and Other Production Accommodation contracts. See “—Stage and Other Production Accommodation.” In addition to charging fees on studio space, we generate turnover from supplying freelance crew, lighting, cameras, technical equipment, dressing rooms and production offices. Rental rates for the Television Studios are packaged to include these services. Over half of turnover related to the Television Studios business line typically relates to these hired-in services specific to a production’s needs. Our Television Studios business is expected to continue to operate as it has historically, as the Television Studios are not subject to the Disney Long-term Contract.

Ancillary services at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios are offered to customers hiring our studios and typically include post production services, utilities and revenue or profit share agreements with preferred service providers (for example, the exclusive provision of lighting equipment through Pinewood MBS). Our ancillary category contains two business lines (Ancillary Studio Services and Post Production) at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios which in total accounted for 6.0% of our Contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021. _Ancillary Studio Services_ Ancillary Studio Services accounted for 1.9% of our Contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021. Ancillary Studio Services include the provision of utilities (electricity, heating oil, kerosene and gas) to customers on-site, which are sourced through our main supply. We also generate turnover from revenue or profit-sharing agreements with preferred service providers, such as Pinewood MBS. Lighting equipment at both Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios is exclusively provided by Pinewood MBS, a joint venture between the Company and MBS Media Campus, a California-based production ----- resource provider. Pinewood MBS collaborates with production staff to deliver a comprehensive equipment package to producers. The Company has a 25% interest in Pinewood MBS which increased from 15% in June 2020 pursuant to the terms of the Pinewood MBS commercial arrangement. Under standard terms for traditional hire contracts, production companies are required to use Pinewood MBS for production lighting. For more information, see “Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations— _Factors Affecting Comparability—Entry into Pinewood MBS Arrangement.” This position is also reflected in our_ Long-term Contracts with Disney and Netflix. In addition, we offer further operational services such as telephone, mailroom and operational support services to our customers at each of Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios. _Post Production_ Post Production accounted for 4.1% of our Contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021 and benefits from relationships and proximity to our Stage and Other Production Accommodation customer base. Post Production provides support to content creators. This business line includes localisation services which offers audio mixing in multiple languages for our customers who require international re-versioning services. In addition, through this business line we offer our customers mixing theatres, cutting rooms, and production offices available for dry hire at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, all of which are excluded from our Long-term Contracts. _Post Production mixing theatre at Pinewood Studios. © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited._ Historically, through Post Production we offered picture services and preparation of “dailies,” or raw, unedited production footage prepared at the end of day of filming and creative audio services involving sound mixing and voice over audio. As of summer 2019, we began to phase out our Pinewood Digital “picture services” business and as of spring 2020, we began to phase out our creative audio business. In addition to picture services and creative audio services, we historically have provided a range of creative audio services to on and off-site film and television productions, including painting, prop-making and drapery through Pinewood Creative. We considered Pinewood Creative to be non-core and ceased these activities in 2017. -----

Other activities include International Sales and Marketing Services and consultancy services offered to film studios around the world. _International Sales and Marketing_ We offer International Sales and Marketing services and franchise services to film studios across the world. Our International Sales and Marketing business line helps us support our market leading position by allowing us to offer our customers a global offering while providing us with a global view of the market and widening our relationships. In connection with our International Sales and Marketing services, we often license the Pinewood brand and provide either sales and marketing services or, less frequently, consultancy services to third parties in exchange for a fee and, in certain circumstances, an ownership or economic interest in their business. We offer services pursuant to sales and marketing contracts for studios operated by international partners in Canada (Pinewood Toronto Studios) and the Dominican Republic (Pinewood Dominican Republic Studios), and historically, in the United States (Pinewood Atlanta Studios) and Malaysia (Pinewood Iskandar Malaysia Studios). These sales and marketing contracts generally have terms of five to ten years. Pursuant to all sales and marketing contracts, we charge an annual sales and marketing fee. We also managed a studio in Wales under a management services agreement (Pinewood Studio Wales) which was terminated on March 31, 2020. Historically, we leased the studio in Wales from the Welsh Ministers. The lease was terminated by agreement in October 2017 and following this termination, we provided management services in return for a fee up to March 31, 2020. We hold a negligible equity interest in Pinewood Dominican Republic Studios. We historically held a negligible equity interest in Pinewood Iskandar Malaysia Studios (which ended in July 2019 upon the termination of our relationship) and a 40% equity interest in Pinewood Atlanta Studios. On August 5, 2019, we completed the sale of our 40% equity in Pinewood Atlanta Studios; however, we continued to provide sales and marketing services until October 14, 2020 under a management services agreement and maintained a trademark license with Pinewood Forest (an entity owned by Pinewood Atlanta Studios). Pinewood Atlanta Studios ceased to be a Pinewood-branded studio on December 14, 2020 with the trademark license with Pinewood Forest also being terminated at this time. Historically, fees earned under this management service contract were reflected in our Other Activities business line up to the point of termination of the management services agreement and therefore impact the financial information presented in this Offering Memorandum. For more information, see “—Key _Factors Affecting Comparability of Future Results of Operations—Exit from Joint Ventures and Third-Party Studio Licenses—Pinewood Atlanta Studios Joint Venture and Management Services Agreement” and Note 3 to_ the Audited Consolidated Financial Statements of Pinewood Group Limited as of and for the fiscal years ended March 31, 2020 and 2021 included elsewhere within this Offering Memorandum.

Our total Contribution across all business lines was £86.9 million for the last twelve months ended September 30, 2021. Our Adjusted EBITDA and maintenance capital expenditure across all business lines for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021 were £64.0 million and £3.6 million, respectively. A description of each of our six business lines is set forth below within the broader categories of rental activities, ancillary activities and other activities.

We earned 98.6% of our total Contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2021 in the United Kingdom, primarily in relation to activities at Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, our two wholly-owned freehold studios set over 502 acres with approximately 2.0 million square feet of space in close proximity to central London which host 38 sound stages. The recent Valuation Report of our UK freehold estate indicated a Market Value of £2,158 million, an uplift of £736 million compared to the prior valuation of £1,422 million as of January 11, 2021 as a result of ongoing development projects. This valuation is based on a discounted cash flow method which reflects the projected net operating income generated by the properties in addition to the valuation of the surplus land. See “Property Valuation.” For further information on Pinewood Studios and Shepperton Studios, see “—Pinewood Studios” and “—Shepperton Studios.” The table provides an overview of the core properties that we own and operate as of the date of this Offering Memorandum. For discussion on the anticipated impact of our expansion projects, see “Management’s _Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations—Factors Affecting Comparability of Future Results of Operations—Impact of Expansion Projects.”_ -----

Subsection Title: Specialty stage &** **Other Pinewood** **Television** **Production ownership** **Total space** **Stage space** **Studios space** **Accommodation** **Media Hub Studio/Facility** **interest** **Acres** **(sq. ft.)** **(sq. ft.)** **(sq. ft.)** **(sq. ft.)** **(sq. ft.)

Subsubsection Text: Pinewood Studios, our largest freehold studio and one of the largest in the world, is situated on 379 acres located in close proximity to central London and offers 1.4 million square feet of lettable space, including 25 stages totalling approximately 565,000 square feet, Other Production Accommodation space of approximately 635,000 square feet and Media Hub space of approximately 238,000 square feet (including owner occupied areas). Pinewood Studios comprises two distinct facilities, situated east (Pinewood East) and west (Pinewood West) of Pinewood Road. Pinewood Studios also features the second largest stage in Europe and one of the largest stages in the world, the ‘007’ stage, which is 59,092 square feet and has hosted production activities for films such as Charlie_ _and the Chocolate Factory, The Da Vinci Code, Lara Croft Tomb Raider, Mamma Mia!_ and Pirates of _the Caribbean, as well as various Bond films, including_ _Spectre and_ _No Time To Die, and_ _Jurassic World: Dominion. In addition, Pinewood Studios offers specialist stages and studios, including three Television Studios,_ an indoor, permanently-filled specialist underwater facility, and stages with indoor water tanks. Pinewood Studios features one of Europe’s largest exterior water “paddock” tanks, with capacity of 806,000 gallons. Pinewood Studios also hosts a vast range of on-site filming locations featuring approximately six acres of backlots, as well as gardens and woodlands available for outdoor shooting within a secure environment, all of which are flexible and suitable for a variety of production types. The stages can also be used for filmed television, music videos and commercials. _Aerial view of Pinewood Studios. © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited._ ----- Pinewood Studios also offers a range of production and post production services “on-the-lot”, including Post Production and Ancillary Studio Services, as well as a range of tenants in our Media Hub who typically provide services to our film and television production company customers. Since the commencement of the Disney Long-term Contract, 100% of our existing Stage and Other Production Accommodation at Pinewood Studios has been occupied by Disney. Following years of planning process, in 2014, we obtained outline planning consent to develop (i) approximately 300,000 square feet of space in connection with Pinewood East Phase 1, which was completed on budget and on time in July 2016; (ii) approximately 205,000 square feet in connection with Pinewood East Phase 2, which was completed in autumn 2019 (with one of the workshop blocks, totalling approximately 39,000 square feet, completed in summer 2020) within budget and on time and (iii) a further approximately 150,000 square feet GEA in connection with Pinewood East Phase 3. _New stages under construction at Pinewood Studios © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited_ Looking ahead, we are actively pursuing several projects for expansion at Pinewood Studios. We are developing five additional stages at Pinewood West, for which construction is underway and is expected to complete in 2022, collectively comprising approximately 100,000 square feet. These stages are included in the demise of the Disney Long-term Contract. We also have outline planning consent at Pinewood Studios to develop an additional approximately 150,000 square feet of lettable area in connection with Pinewood East Phase 3. In September 2020, we submitted a detailed planning application for the development of four new sound stages and a workshop totalling approximately 90,000 square feet of lettable area at Pinewood East Phase 3 and received consent in June 2021. Further, in September 2020, we submitted an outline planning application for Pinewood South for a global screen industries growth hub comprising: (i) additional production accommodation space, including six sound stages, (ii) a visitor experience, (iii) an education hub, and (iv) a business growth hub totaling approximately 750,000 square feet. We expect to receive a decision from the local planning authority before January 2022. ----- _Moneypenny office building at Pinewood Studios. © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited. Pinewood plan. © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited._ -----

Shepperton Studios, our second largest freehold studio, which we acquired in 2001, is situated on approximately 123-acres in close proximity to central London and offers approximately 560,000 square feet of lettable space, including 14 stages totalling approximately 167,000 square feet, Other Production Accommodation space of approximately 270,000 square feet and Media Hub space of approximately 123,000 square feet (including owner occupied space). Shepperton Studios has hosted production activities for films such as _Alien, Batman _Begins, Beauty and the Beast, Bridget Jones’s Diary, Fast & Furious 6, Gandhi, Gladiator, Gravity, Guardians of the Galaxy, Love Actually_ and _The Mummy. Shepperton Studios also offers a vast range of on-site filming_ locations featuring approximately six acres of backlots running parallel to the River Ash, gardens and a 17th century estate for shooting within a secure environment, all of which are flexible and suitable for a variety of film and television production types, especially big-budget film making. _Aerial view of Shepperton Studios. © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited._ Shepperton Studios offers a range of production and post production services “on-the-lot”, including Post Production and Ancillary Studio Services, as well as a range of tenants in our Media Hub who typically provide services to our film and television production company customers. Of the total of approximately 123 acres of land we own at Shepperton Studios, 97 acres has the potential for future development. The initial outline planning consent for the expansion and development of Shepperton Studios was obtained in July 2019. This expansion, which we refer to as the “Shepperton Masterplan”, provides us an opportunity to meet any stable, excess demand for studio space. Our strong relationships with our customers, combined with the nature of customer contracts for our studios, provide us with the visibility required to gradually develop this additional capacity. The planning consent expires within ten years if the site is not developed earlier. In February 2021, we received reserved matters planning permission for the north west area of the site to develop three sound stages and other production accommodation totalling approximately 165,000 square feet. In July 2021 we submitted an additional planning application for a standalone workshop of approximately 19,000 square feet for which we expect to receive a decision from the local authority before January 2022. If successful, the total area for Shepperton North West development will therefore be approximately 185,000 square feet of stage and other production accommodation space. We also submitted a further application for a satellite car park ----- in September 2021 for the Shepperton North West development, and expect to receive a decision from the local planning authority before January 2022. In April 2021, we received reserved matters planning permission for Shepperton South to develop 14 sound stages, production buildings and other infrastructure, totalling approximately 1.0 million square feet GEA and further received permission for the Shepperton South entrance building in August 2021. In addition, we received permission from the local authority in September 2021 to undertake certain improvement works on the existing Shepperton North site. _Graphic of Shepperton Expansion Project © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited. Graphic of Shepperton Studios after the Shepperton Expansion Project © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited._ Since the commencement of the Netflix Long-term Contract, 100% of Stage and Other Production Accommodation at Shepperton North has been occupied by Netflix. ----- Under the Netflix Shepperton South Long-term Contract, 50% of the space at Shepperton South will be leased to Netflix on completion of the Shepperton Expansion Project. _Shepperton map. © 2021 Pinewood Group Limited._

While our studios can accommodate productions of all sizes and quality given the scale of our facilities, our customer base comprises a finite base of major film production companies, for whom we are often the provider of choice. This results in a relatively high level of customer concentration compared to other sectors. Our relationships with such customers are long-term and lasting, generating significant repeat business. For example, each of NBCUniversal, Warner Bros., EON Productions, Disney and 20th Century Fox (prior to being acquired by Disney) have been customers for over 50 years and have collectively made over 220 films at Pinewood-branded studios. In addition, we have long-term relationships with other film production companies such as Paramount Studios, Sony Pictures and Lionsgate which span over 40 years, 20 years and 10 years, respectively. More recently, we have also formed relationships with streaming platforms such as Amazon, Netflix and HBO Max that have collectively made over 38 films at Pinewood-branded studios. Since Pinewood Studios’ opening in 1936, over 2,000 films have been produced at Pinewood-branded studios. The table below sets forth an overview of our key film production company and streaming service relationships, blockbuster films and High-end TV series produced at Pinewood-branded studios. ----- **PRODUCTI ONS FILMED AT RELATION** **PINEWOO SHIP** **D- FILM PRODUCTION** **LENGTH** **BRANDED COMPANY** **(YEARS)** **STUDIOS[(1)]** **INDICATIVE PRODUCTION TITLES** NBCUniversal 60+ 71 _Last Night in Soho_ (2021);
